alerts.message: Sudden severe headache can be serious. Seek urgent medical assessment.
Neurological changes or recent head injury need same-day medical advice.
Neck stiffness, rash, or fever with headache requires emergency assessment.
Severe headaches in pregnancy or post-partum need urgent medical review.
New headaches age 50+ should be reviewed by a GP.
Headaches lasting more than a week should be checked by a GP.

Frequent nosebleeds or one-sided blockage should be assessed by a GP.
Pregnancy and breastfeeding require pharmacist advice before treatment.
Young children with hay fever should be assessed by a pharmacist or GP.

Vomiting blood or black stools require emergency medical care.
Unintentional weight loss or persistent vomiting needs GP review.
Chest pain with indigestion requires urgent medical help.
New indigestion symptoms age 55+ need GP assessment.
Persistent indigestion longer than 3 weeks should be reviewed by a GP.

alerts.message: Blood in stool needs urgent medical advice.
High fever with diarrhoea requires assessment by a clinician.
Diarrhoea lasting more than 5 days should be reviewed by a GP.
Signs of dehydration need urgent medical care.
Recent antibiotics or hospital stay can signal serious infection – seek GP advice.
Travel-related diarrhoea with fever warrants medical review.
Pregnancy with diarrhoea should be assessed by a pharmacist or GP.

alerts.message: Breathing or swallowing difficulty needs urgent medical help.
Severe one-sided throat pain can indicate quinsy – seek urgent care.
Severe rash or feeling very unwell should be checked by a clinician.
Sore throats lasting longer than a week require GP review.
